input.label: Select Leader (Based on Org Chart)
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup LDAPMgmtChain | makemv delim="|" ManagementChain_sAMAccountName | stats values(sAMAccountName) as user by ManagementChain_sAMAccountName | eval tstats_search_criteria="(user=" . mvjoin(user," OR user=") . ")" | lookup LDAPSearch sAMAccountName as ManagementChain_sAMAccountName OUTPUTNEW name | eval MyName=coalesce(name . " (" . ManagementChain_sAMAccountName . ")", ManagementChain_sAMAccountName) | sort MyName

input.label: Tagged Users
input.searchString: |inputlookup TaggedUsers | stats values(user) as user by category | eval search="(user=" . mvjoin(user, " OR user=") . ")" | stats values(category) as category by search | eval category=mvjoin(category," / ")

html.p: This report analyzes the timeframe that data is searched over. This is relevant for determining how to allocate faster disks to hot/warm. Some customers will have more than 99.9% of their time spent searching the last 4 hours, in which case it may not make sense to invest in spacious hot/warm disks. However, for some other customers, virtually all of their use cases will be over very long periods of time.

What the below report is measuring is the difference between the exec_time (when the search was run) and the earliest time of the search. Note that this isn't really a conclusive measure, particularly for organizations that have all time enabled by default, and doesn't factor in all manner of different components (sparsity of the search, location of bloom filters, etc.). Very importantly, if a company has five days of data in hot and a search runs over the past six days of data, this makes no accounting for the fact that most of the runtime is probably spent on hot/warm disks. (If you really need it, I have the search to analyze that.. but it takes almost literally forever, so I didn't include it -- email me).

Limitations notwithstanding, this can provide guidance for how people use your SplunkÂ® environment. If you would like a comparison to other companies, export the below dataset and the Top Users dataset from the main page and email them to me, and I will provide you a comparison. (Why those two? Give me some data and I'll give you some! Feel free to exclude the usernames.)

table.title: Lifetime of Searches
table.searchString:
| tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` prestats=t count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt from `SA_SearchHistory` where $sh_clause$ $user_criteria$ $tagged_user_criteria$ (Search_History.searchtype=adhoc* OR Search_History.searchtype=scheduled* OR Search_History.searchtype=summarization* OR Search_History.searchtype=dashboard*) Search_History.search_et_diff>0 Search_History.search_et_diff<= 960 | eval label="<= 16min", order="01"
| tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` prestats=t append=t count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt from `SA_SearchHistory` where $sh_clause$ $user_criteria$ $tagged_user_criteria$ (Search_History.searchtype=adhoc* OR Search_History.searchtype=scheduled* OR Search_History.searchtype=summarization* OR Search_History.searchtype=dashboard*) Search_History.search_et_diff>960 Search_History.search_et_diff<= 3600 | eval label=coalesce(label, "16min <= 1hr"), order=coalesce(order, "03")
| tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` prestats=t append=t count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt from `SA_SearchHistory` where $sh_clause$ $user_criteria$ $tagged_user_criteria$ (Search_History.searchtype=adhoc* OR Search_History.searchtype=scheduled* OR Search_History.searchtype=summarization* OR Search_History.searchtype=dashboard*) Search_History.search_et_diff>3600 Search_History.search_et_diff<= 7200 | eval label=coalesce(label, "1hr <= 2hrs"), order=coalesce(order, "04")
| tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` prestats=t append=t count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt from `SA_SearchHistory` where $sh_clause$ $user_criteria$ $tagged_user_criteria$ (Search_History.searchtype=adhoc* OR Search_History.searchtype=scheduled* OR Search_History.searchtype=summarization* OR Search_History.searchtype=dashboard*) Search_History.search_et_diff>7200 Search_History.search_et_diff<= 10800 | eval label=coalesce(label, "2hrs <= 3hrs"), order=coalesce(order, "05")
| tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` prestats=t append=t count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt from `SA_SearchHistory` where $sh_clause$ $user_criteria$ $tagged_user_criteria$ (Search_History.searchtype=adhoc* OR Search_History.searchtype=scheduled* OR Search_History.searchtype=summarization* OR Search_History.searchtype=dashboard*) Search_History.search_et_diff>10800 Search_History.search_et_diff<= 14400 | eval label=coalesce(label, "3hrs <= 4hrs"), order=coalesce(order, "06")
| tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` prestats=t append=t count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt from `SA_SearchHistory` where $sh_clause$ $user_criteria$ $tagged_user_criteria$ (Search_History.searchtype=adhoc* OR Search_History.searchtype=scheduled* OR Search_History.searchtype=summarization* OR Search_History.searchtype=dashboard*) Search_History.search_et_diff>14400 Search_History.search_et_diff<= 18000 | eval label=coalesce(label, "4hrs <= 5hrs"), order=coalesce(order, "07")

| stats count dc(Search_History.user) as user avg(Search_History.result_count) as avg_result_count avg(Search_History.scan_count) as avg_scan_count median(Search_History.total_run_time) as median_total_run_time sum(Search_History.total_run_time) as total_trt by order, label | fields - order
| eval "total_trt avg hrs per day"=round(total_trt/3600/30,1) | streamstats sum(total_trt) as Aggregated_Total_Run_Time | eventstats sum(total_trt) as max_trt max(Aggregated_Total_Run_Time) as Max_Ag | eval PercentageOfTotalRuntime = round(total_trt/max_trt * 100,2) | eval AggregatePercentageOfTotalRuntime = round(Aggregated_Total_Run_Time/Max_Ag * 100,2) | foreach PercentageOfTotalRuntime AggregatePercentageOfTotalRuntime [fieldformat <<FIELD>> = <<FIELD>> . "%" ]| fields - Max_Ag max_trt

chart.title: Change over Time (**Log Scale**)
chart.searchString: | tstats `SearchActivitySummaries` perc5(Search_History.search_et_diff) as perc5_et_diff perc25(Search_History.search_et_diff) as perc25_et_diff median(Search_History.search_et_diff) as median_et_diff perc75(Search_History.search_et_diff) as perc75_et_diff perc95(Search_History.search_et_diff) as perc95_et_diff from `SA_SearchHistory` by _time span=1d| timechart bins=1000 avg(*) as *
